snippet: On Tuesday, residents of Connecticut’s largest city elected Mr. Ganim, a Democrat, once again to lead the city he was convicted of betraying a dozen years ago.
abstract: Joseph P Ganim resoundingly wins race for mayor of Bridgeport, Conn, beating out Mary-Jane Foster and Republican Enrique Torres; Ganim's victory is remarkable given his widely publicized fall from grace in 2003, when he resigned as mayor after being convicted of bribery.
lead_paragraph: On Tuesday, residents of Connecticut’s largest city elected Mr. Ganim, a Democrat, once again to lead the city he was convicted of betraying a dozen years ago.

headline.main: Joseph Ganim, Disgraced Ex-Mayor of Bridgeport, Conn., Wins Back Job
headline.print_headline: Comeback in Bridgeport for Disgraced Ex-Mayor
